meaningMnemonic: When you want to know <kanji>what</kanji> the <kanji>circumstances</kanji> are around you, you have to ask <vocabulary>why</vocabulary>. Why do things happen around you? Asking why is very important if you want to understand the world.
readingMnemonic:
The reading for this is an exception. The reading for 何 is just the first な from なに. You can remember the second part this way:

No one knows quite <vocabulary>how</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>why</vocabulary> that big <reading>ze</reading>ppelin (ぜ) crashed in the 1930s. People are still asking today and no one has any answers. We have to keep asking until we get some.
